Description: Body sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; single added white band and trace of white motif below; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two white bands (Williams 1983, 169) and many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 169, no. 162)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 729, no. 887)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1723) (phase 2)
